main event: An unidentified rectangular, silver object was observed moving fast over New Baden, Illinois on 18 September 1954. It disappeared behind trees and appeared to be ascending. The sighting lasted for 6 seconds and the object made no sound.
interesting points: The object was described as having a red and pinkish glow in the upper left corner and a green and blue glow from the rest of the body, with the brightness of a fluorescent light.
The witness, who was a senior electrical base engineer at Scott AFB, Illinois, mentioned that there was no sound but stated that he was slightly hard of hearing.
The sighting occurred early in the morning, between daylight and sunrise, and under slightly cloudy conditions.
The Wing Intelligence Officer, a Major, suggested the possible cause of the sighting to be a reflection from an aircraft, although no aircraft were reported in the vicinity at that time.
The report concluded that there was insufficient data for final analysis, leaving the nature of the object unexplained.
witnesses: Senior electrical base engineer at Scott AFB, Illinois
